newsitem.title: EGYPT: Iraq signs for 37,500 T sugar from Egypt - paper.
newsitem.headline: Iraq signs for 37,500 T sugar from Egypt - paper.

text.p: Iraq has agreed to buy 37,500 tonnes of sugar from Egypt at a price of $14 million, the Egyptian government newspaper al-Ahram said on Friday.
A contract was signed on Thursday and the Egyptian government will be contacting the United Nations to clear the shipment under the "oil-for-food" scheme, it said.
Egypt is a net sugar importer but it does export small quantities of white sugar refined from imported raws when the refineries have no domestic cane to process.
The newspaper said that with the new sugar deal the Egyptian state's Holding Company for Food Industries had agreements with Iraq to export goods worth $46 million.
This includes 50,000 tonnes of sugar, 10,000 tonnes of soap and 5,200 tonnes of detergents, it added. Letters of credit for the first 12,500 tonnes of sugar have been opened.
